item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

import java.io.FileInputStream; static public void main(String args[]){ try { FileInputStream fiis = new FileInputStream(args[0]); long l = fiis.available(); byte contents[] = new byte[l]; fiis.read(contents); fiis.close(); System.out.write(contents); } catch (Throwable th){ System.err.println("An error has occured: " + th.getMessage()); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Puts the file into a string, then prints.

[code]import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;

/**

  • Date: Apr 22, 2007

  • @author Robert Saunders (Pwnd)

  • @todo this
    */
    public class SimpleFileReader {
    File f;

    public SimpleFileReader(File f) {
    this.f = f;
    }

    public String readFile() {
    byte[] bytes = null;
    try {
    FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(f);
    bytes = new byte[fis.available()];
    fis.read(bytes);
    fis.close();

     } catch (Exception e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
 return new String(bytes);

    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println(new SimpleFileReader(new File(args[0])).readFile());
    }
    }
    [/code]

Should work. I didn’t test.

Read full topic
